function.name: bookmarks
function.description: Read bookmarks using the specified parameters.

param.name: cameraId
param.description: Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

param.name: startTime
param.description: Start time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds since epoch). Default value is 0. Should be less than endTime.

param.name: endTime
param.description: End time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds since epoch). Default value is the current time. Should be greater than startTime.

param.name: sortBy
param.description: Field to sort the results by. Default value is "startTime".

param.name: sortOrder
param.description: Sort order. Default order is ascending.

param.name: limit
param.description: Maximum number of bookmarks to return. Unlimited by default.

param.name: filter
param.description: Text-search filter string.

param.name: local
param.description: If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

param.name: extraFormatting
param.description: If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

param.name: format
param.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

value.name: csv
value.description: CSV data format. In case of a hierarchical structure, only the top level data is provided.

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about accessing cameras" live video and footage.

function.name: <cameraId>
function.caption: RTSP Streaming
function.description: Open RTSP video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Example: rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

param.name: pos
param.description: By default, the server opens a camera at the live position. This parameter defines position in an archive (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

param.name: resolution
param.description: Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or height only (for instance 240p)

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog. Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

param.name: codec
param.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value is H263.

param.name: stream
param.description: Open high quality stream if parameter is 0 or low quality stream if parameter is 1. By default server auto detect preferred stream index based on destination resolution.

param.name: speed
param.description: Playback speed. Only values in range [1..32] are supported. Default value is 1.

function.name: media/<cameraId>.<format>
function.caption: HTTP Streaming
function.description: Open HTTP video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Codec and stream format can be specified in URL parameters. Live stream and archive can be downloaded. If required and possible, media stream transcoding is performed on-the-fly. Stream format can be one of the following: webm, mpegts, mpjpeg (motion jpeg). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/12AB42FD5912.webm

param.name: resolution
param.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

param.name: pos
param.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

param.name: endPos
param.description: If present, specifies archive stream end position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). It is used only if "pos" parameter is present.

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog.

param.name: sfd
param.description: Stand Frame Duration. If the parameter is present, video speed is limited by real time.

param.name: rt
param.description: Turn on realtime optimization. It will drop some frames if not enough CPU for realtime transcoding.

result.caption: Video stream in the requested format

function.name: hls/<cameraId>.m3u
function.caption: HLS Streaming
function.description: Open HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) video stream from a camera. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.m3u

param.name: pos
param.description: Camera archive position to open (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: hi
param.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

param.name: lo
param.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

function.name: hls/<cameraId>.<format>
function.caption: Direct download
function.description: Download fragment of a camera archive, identified by its start time and duration. It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras). Fragment can be downloaded in mpeg-2/ts (.ts) or Matroska (.mkv) format. No transcoding is performed. Stream format can be one of following: ts, mkv. Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.mkv?startDatetime=2015-02-05T19:00&duration=10

param.name: pos
param.description: Fragment start time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

param.name: duration
param.description: Fragment length in seconds

param.name: hi
param.description: Return high quality stream

param.name: lo
param.description: Return low quality stream

result.caption: Video stream in the requested format

group.groupDescription: Request authentication methods supported by server.

function.name: HTTP Basic/Digest authentication
function.description:
This method is preferable for external applications, most of HTTP libraries support it.
Server is fully conformant with the authentication defined in rfc2617 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617).

function.name: Cookie-based authentication
function.description:
This method should only be used in browser javascript applications.
Cookie authorization scheme allows to avoid standard login/password dialog in web-applications.
It provides you a way to replace it with your own dialog.
It works mostly like sessions, but is a bit more secure because it doesn't send user's password over HTTP.
To check authentication:
Call GET /api/getCurrentUser
You will get 401 (Unauthorised) in case you need authorization
You will get 200 (OK) and the user object otherwise
To log in:
Call GET /api/getNonce
In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce (nonce is a session key for this user)
Calculate authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Call POST /api/cookieLogin and pass the "auth" parameter in the json request body
Server will check authentication and set session cookies
Executing requests:
Session cookie should be supplied with every request, browser does it automatically if cookies are enabled
HTTP header Nx-Vms-Csrf-Token should contain the key from nx-vms-csrf-token cookie value
To log out:
Call POST /api/cookieLogout
Server will clear the session cookies

function.name: URL-based authentication
function.description:
This method should only be used if other methods are not applicable, e.g. webm direct link.
Add the "auth" parameter to the URL query section of any GET request
Call /api/getNonce to get realm and nonce from the server (the current server time is used as a nonce value, and the nonce is valid for about 5 minutes)
Calculate the authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Specify the authentication hash in the URL parameter: http://127.0.0.1:7001/method?auth=auth_digest&other_params

function.name: Calculating authentication hash
function.description:
For URL-based authentication and cookie-based authentication you need to calculate the hash manually, using the following algorithm:
Call GET /api/getNonce
In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce
Translate user's username to the lower case
Check the required method ("GET" for HTTP GET requests, "POST" for HTTP POST requests, "PLAY" for RTSP etc)
digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password)
partial_ha2 = md5_hex(method + ":")
simplified_ha2 = md5_hex(digest + ":" + nonce + ":" + partial_ha2)
auth_digest = base64(user_name + ":" + nonce + ":" + simplified_ha2)
Here auth_digest is the required authentication hash
